segment.source: MD Conversion - Get started with a paid subscription to Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Get started with a paid subscription to Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Whether you start with a 30-day free trial, or start with a paid subscription, Microsoft Intune provides a quick and easy way for you to manage mobile devices and computers in your organization.
segment.target: Whether you start with a 30-day free trial, or start with a paid subscription, Microsoft Intune provides a quick and easy way for you to manage mobile devices and computers in your organization.

segment.source: This topic leads you through the steps of setting up a cloud-only instance of

segment.source: This topic focuses on configuring Intune as a standalone service.
segment.target: This topic focuses on configuring Intune as a standalone service.

segment.source: If you're currently using Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (ConfigMgr) to manage computers and servers, you can connect Intune with ConfgMgr in a hybrid deployment.
segment.target: If you're currently using Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (ConfigMgr) to manage computers and servers, you can connect Intune with ConfgMgr in a hybrid deployment.

segment.source: This configuration offers several benefits and leverages your existing on-premises infrastructure.
segment.target: This configuration offers several benefits and leverages your existing on-premises infrastructure.

segment.source: and that you're ready to deploy Intune and make changes to your existing network infrastructure.
segment.target: and that you're ready to deploy Intune and make changes to your existing network infrastructure.

segment.source: This could range from simply adding or updating your internal and external DNS records to connecting your existing Active Directory accounts to Azure Active Directory.
segment.target: This could range from simply adding or updating your internal and external DNS records to connecting your existing Active Directory accounts to Azure Active Directory.

segment.source: Whatever mix of Intune mobile device management features you leverage, you'll need to carefully plan how Intune will interact with your existing network components and services.
segment.target: Whatever mix of Intune mobile device management features you leverage, you'll need to carefully plan how Intune will interact with your existing network components and services.

segment.source: : For most medium-level and enterprise-level organizations, connecting your existing directory services to Intune via Azure Active Directory is the best and most convenient way to manage user identity with Intune.
segment.target: : For most medium-level and enterprise-level organizations, connecting your existing directory services to Intune via Azure Active Directory is the best and most convenient way to manage user identity with Intune.

segment.source: This is especially true if you already use other Microsoft cloud services, such as Office 365 or Exchange Online.
segment.target: This is especially true if you already use other Microsoft cloud services, such as Office 365 or Exchange Online.

segment.source: Synchronizing your existing user accounts using
segment.target: Synchronizing your existing user accounts using

segment.source: is a quick and easy way to connect your on-premises Active Directory to Azure Active Directory and configure a single sign-on authentication experience for your users.
segment.target: is a quick and easy way to connect your on-premises Active Directory to Azure Active Directory and configure a single sign-on authentication experience for your users.

segment.source: : If you want to use your own domain name instead of the default onmicrosoft.com domain generated by the Intune service, some public DNS record updates will be needed when configuring Azure (or other Microsoft cloud services) to use your custom domain.
segment.target: : If you want to use your own domain name instead of the default onmicrosoft.com domain generated by the Intune service, some public DNS record updates will be needed when configuring Azure (or other Microsoft cloud services) to use your custom domain.

segment.source: DNS records are required so that mobile devices can locate the Intune service, as well as making other mobility management services work correctly.
segment.target: DNS records are required so that mobile devices can locate the Intune service, as well as making other mobility management services work correctly.

segment.source: You'll need to decide if you want to manage your DNS records at your DNS host or have Azure or Office 365 create and manage the DNS records for your domain after you change your DNS records to point to these services.
segment.target: You'll need to decide if you want to manage your DNS records at your DNS host or have Azure or Office 365 create and manage the DNS records for your domain after you change your DNS records to point to these services.

segment.source: Step 1: Sign up or sign in to Intune
segment.target: Step 1: Sign up or sign in to Intune

segment.source: Before you either sign up or sign in to Intune, you should consider the following:
segment.target: Before you either sign up or sign in to Intune, you should consider the following:

segment.source: Whether your organization already has a Microsoft Online Services work or school account
segment.target: Whether your organization already has a Microsoft Online Services work or school account

segment.source: Whether you have an Enterprise Agreement or equivalent volume licensing agreement with Microsoft
segment.target: Whether you have an Enterprise Agreement or equivalent volume licensing agreement with Microsoft

segment.source: Sign up for a NEW account if either of the following is true:
segment.target: Sign up for a NEW account if either of the following is true:

segment.source: Sign in with your WORK or SCHOOL account if:
segment.target: Sign in with your WORK or SCHOOL account if:

segment.source: You don’t have a work or school account.
segment.target: You don’t have a work or school account.

segment.source: A work or school account is provided when you sign a volume licensing agreement with Microsoft or subscribe to Office 365.
segment.target: A work or school account is provided when you sign a volume licensing agreement with Microsoft or subscribe to Office 365.

segment.source: If your organization has not signed an Enterprise Agreement or equivalent volume licensing agreement with Microsoft (or has an Office 365 account), then you do not have a Microsoft Online Services account that you can use to sign in to Microsoft Online Services.
segment.target: If your organization has not signed an Enterprise Agreement or equivalent volume licensing agreement with Microsoft (or has an Office 365 account), then you do not have a Microsoft Online Services account that you can use to sign in to Microsoft Online Services.

segment.target: You should sign up for a new account if you are using your

segment.source: Step 2: Configure a custom domain name
segment.target: Step 2: Configure a custom domain name

segment.target: uses the domain name that you select when you subscribe to the service, which looks like

segment.source: When your organization owns a custom domain, you can configure your instance of
segment.target: When your organization owns a custom domain, you can configure your instance of

segment.source: to use that domain instead of the domain name provided with your subscription.
segment.target: to use that domain instead of the domain name provided with your subscription.

segment.source: Before you create new user accounts or synchronize accounts from your on-premises Active Directory, we strongly recommend that you decide whether to use only the .onmicrosoft.com domain or to add one or more of your custom domain names.
segment.target: Before you create new user accounts or synchronize accounts from your on-premises Active Directory, we strongly recommend that you decide whether to use only the .onmicrosoft.com domain or to add one or more of your custom domain names.

segment.source: If you don't configure a custom domain name and suffix, each user account you import receives the onmicrosoft.com suffix for its user principal name (UPN).
segment.target: If you don't configure a custom domain name and suffix, each user account you import receives the onmicrosoft.com suffix for its user principal name (UPN).

segment.source: Configuring a custom domain before adding users can help simplify the management of user identities for your subscription by enabling users to sign in with the credentials they use to access other domain resources.
segment.target: Configuring a custom domain before adding users can help simplify the management of user identities for your subscription by enabling users to sign in with the credentials they use to access other domain resources.

segment.source: to use your organizations custom domain name are the same as for other Azure AD tenants, use the information and procedures found in
segment.target: to use your organizations custom domain name are the same as for other Azure AD tenants, use the information and procedures found in

segment.source: For more information about using your custom domain with a cloud-based service from Microsoft, see
segment.target: For more information about using your custom domain with a cloud-based service from Microsoft, see

segment.source: Step 3: Synchronize Active Directory and add users to Intune
segment.target: Step 3: Synchronize Active Directory and add users to Intune

segment.source: As mentioned, you can configure directory synchronization to import user accounts from your on-premises Active Directory to Microsoft Azure Active Directory.
segment.target: As mentioned, you can configure directory synchronization to import user accounts from your on-premises Active Directory to Microsoft Azure Active Directory.

segment.source: Additionally, when you activate directory synchronization in your Intune tenant, you are turning on this feature across all the Microsoft cloud services that you are subscribed to.
segment.target: Additionally, when you activate directory synchronization in your Intune tenant, you are turning on this feature across all the Microsoft cloud services that you are subscribed to.

segment.source: When you use multiple services with the same Azure AD, the user accounts that you synchronize are available to each cloud-based service that shares your Azure AD.
segment.target: When you use multiple services with the same Azure AD, the user accounts that you synchronize are available to each cloud-based service that shares your Azure AD.

segment.source: Having your on-premises Active Directory service connected with all of your Azure Active Directory-based services makes managing user identity much simpler.
segment.target: Having your on-premises Active Directory service connected with all of your Azure Active Directory-based services makes managing user identity much simpler.

segment.source: You can also configure single sign-on features to make the authentication experience for your users familiar and easy.
segment.target: You can also configure single sign-on features to make the authentication experience for your users familiar and easy.

segment.source: is the single tool and guided experience for connecting your on-premises identity infrastructure to the cloud.
segment.target: is the single tool and guided experience for connecting your on-premises identity infrastructure to the cloud.

segment.source: Choose your topology and needs (single or multiple directories, password sync or federation), and the wizard will deploy and configure all components required to get your connection up and running, including sync services, Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS), and the Azure AD PowerShell module.
segment.target: Choose your topology and needs (single or multiple directories, password sync or federation), and the wizard will deploy and configure all components required to get your connection up and running, including sync services, Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS), and the Azure AD PowerShell module.

segment.source: Azure AD Connect encompasses functionality that was previously released as Dirsync and Azure AD Sync.
segment.target: Azure AD Connect encompasses functionality that was previously released as Dirsync and Azure AD Sync.

segment.source: Learn more about directory integration at
segment.target: Learn more about directory integration at

segment.target: After you've added users to your Intune subscription, we recommend that you grant a few user accounts administrative credentials.

segment.target: The console that you use to assign administrative credentials depends on the type of administrator you want to assign:

segment.target: to assign this type of administrator to manage your subscription, including billing, cloud storage, and managing the users who can use

segment.source: to assign this type of administrator for day-to-day tasks including management of mobile devices or computers, deploying policy or software, and running reports.
segment.target: to assign this type of administrator for day-to-day tasks including management of mobile devices or computers, deploying policy or software, and running reports.

segment.target: Similarities between Active Directory and Azure AD

segment.source: Step 5: Create groups to organize users and devices
segment.target: Step 5: Create groups to organize users and devices

segment.source: give you great flexibility for managing your devices and users.
segment.target: give you great flexibility for managing your devices and users.

segment.source: You can set up groups to suit your organizational needs (for example, by geographic location, department, or hardware characteristics) and use them to perform a wide variety of administrative tasks, from deploying policies for a set of users to deploying applications to a set of devices.
segment.target: You can set up groups to suit your organizational needs (for example, by geographic location, department, or hardware characteristics) and use them to perform a wide variety of administrative tasks, from deploying policies for a set of users to deploying applications to a set of devices.

segment.source: Use device groups to deploy apps and updates, and configure other features.
segment.target: Use device groups to deploy apps and updates, and configure other features.

segment.target: Step 6: Create policies and publish an app

segment.source: policies provide settings that help you control the security settings on mobile devices, maintain Windows Firewall and Endpoint Protection settings for computers, and deploy applications.
segment.target: policies provide settings that help you control the security settings on mobile devices, maintain Windows Firewall and Endpoint Protection settings for computers, and deploy applications.

segment.target: If you are planning to use Intune for devices that you configure for production use after the trial, it's absolutely essential that you follow the instructions in

segment.source: You can perform two types of app installations using Intune.
segment.target: You can perform two types of app installations using Intune.

segment.source: , which automatically deploys the app to managed computers.
segment.target: , which automatically deploys the app to managed computers.

segment.source: , which deploys the app, or a link to the app, to the Intune company portal so that users can choose whether to install it on their computers or on their mobile devices.
segment.target: , which deploys the app, or a link to the app, to the Intune company portal so that users can choose whether to install it on their computers or on their mobile devices.

segment.source: Before using Intune to deploy apps, make sure that you have the appropriate licenses to publish, distribute, and use the app.
segment.target: Before using Intune to deploy apps, make sure that you have the appropriate licenses to publish, distribute, and use the app.

segment.source: The Licenses workspace lets you add and manage license agreement information for apps or software purchased through Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements, and for Microsoft or non-Microsoft software that was purchased by other means.
segment.target: The Licenses workspace lets you add and manage license agreement information for apps or software purchased through Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements, and for Microsoft or non-Microsoft software that was purchased by other means.

segment.source: You can then create license reports that display managed license usage information throughout your company to stay informed of license usage activity.
segment.target: You can then create license reports that display managed license usage information throughout your company to stay informed of license usage activity.

segment.source: In these steps, you'll set up a mobile device configuration policy and a Windows computer firewall policy, and configure Skype as an available install for mobile devices after they're enrolled.
segment.target: In these steps, you'll set up a mobile device configuration policy and a Windows computer firewall policy, and configure Skype as an available install for mobile devices after they're enrolled.

segment.source: After you add and deploy a new policy, all users or devices in the group to which you deployed the policy inherit the settings as their baseline policy.
segment.target: After you add and deploy a new policy, all users or devices in the group to which you deployed the policy inherit the settings as their baseline policy.

segment.source: You can always review and edit the details of these policies later from the Policy workspace.
segment.target: You can always review and edit the details of these policies later from the Policy workspace.

segment.source: After you complete the initial configuration steps for an Intune paid subscription, you should consider enabling additional mobile device management functionality.
segment.target: After you complete the initial configuration steps for an Intune paid subscription, you should consider enabling additional mobile device management functionality.

segment.source: For users with mobile devices that haven't enrolled in Intune, you can enable Exchange ActiveSync management using a connector for on-premises Exchange and for Exchange Online in Microsoft Office 365.
segment.target: For users with mobile devices that haven't enrolled in Intune, you can enable Exchange ActiveSync management using a connector for on-premises Exchange and for Exchange Online in Microsoft Office 365.

segment.source: The Exchange connector connects you with your Exchange deployment and lets you manage mobile devices through the Intune administration console.
segment.target: The Exchange connector connects you with your Exchange deployment and lets you manage mobile devices through the Intune administration console.

segment.source: To learn more about the Exchange connector, see
segment.target: To learn more about the Exchange connector, see

segment.source: Microsoft Intune provides alerts and reports that you can use to help monitor devices, as well as software license status and actions that affect devices (such as wiping a device).
segment.target: Microsoft Intune provides alerts and reports that you can use to help monitor devices, as well as software license status and actions that affect devices (such as wiping a device).

segment.source: To learn more about reporting, see
segment.target: To learn more about reporting, see
